contentrichtext.text: [[Image:LocalNUTS3Oeste.svg|thumb|250px|right|Map showing the location of the Oeste subregion]] [[File:Headquarters of Associação de Municípios do Oeste.jpg|thumb|right|Façade of the headquarters of the Associação de Municípios do Oeste, showing the names of the member municipalities.]] '''Oeste''', ([[Portuguese language|Portuguese]] for "West") is a [[Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics|NUTS 3]] sub-region (Portuguese: ''sub-região'') of the [[Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics|NUTS 2]] [[Centro Region]] of [[Portugal]]. The sub-region is coterminous with the Comunidade Intermunicipal do Oeste (West Intermunicipal Community) of the same name.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amo.oestedigital.pt/News/newsdetail.aspx?news=05d50aaf-bae8-4e6e-ae9d-684d97a2cc42|title=Associação de Municípios do Oeste transforma-se em Comunidade Intermunicipal|publisher=Associação de Municípios do Oeste|accessdate=2008-11-30}}</ref> The sub-region has an area of 2,214.8 km² (2003 updated statistics) and a population of 353,050 (2005 statistics). ==Municipalities== The twelve [[Municipalities of Portugal|municipalities]] of the sub-region and the intermunicipal community are: * [[Alcobaça Municipality| Alcobaça]] * [[Alenquer Municipality, Portugal|Alenquer ]] * [[Arruda dos Vinhos Municipality|Arruda dos Vinhos]] * [[Bombarral Municipality|Bombarral]] * [[Cadaval Municipality|Cadaval]] * [[Caldas da Rainha Municipality|Caldas da Rainha]] * [[Lourinhã Municipality|Lourinhã]] * [[Nazaré Municipality|Nazaré]] * [[Óbidos Municipality|Óbidos]] * [[Peniche Municipality|Peniche]] * [[Sobral de Monte Agraço Municipality|Sobral de Monte Agraço]] * [[Torres Vedras Municipality|Torres Vedras]] As of 2003, the twelve municipalities contain a total of 121 parishes. The largest cities are Caldas da Rainha (30,000), Torres Vedras (25,000) and Peniche (16,000). It is a region famous for its fruits and vegetables production, namely the famous [[pêra rocha]] variety. ==References== <references/> ==External links== *[http://www.amo.oestedigital.pt Comunidade Intermunicipal do Oeste] *[http://www.oesteonline.pt/ Jornal Oeste Online] — online newspaper *[http://www.oestediario.com/ Oeste Diário] — regional portal *[http://www.oeste.tv/ OESTE.TV // Vídeo] — online "television" channel *[http://www.oestedigital.pt/ Portal Oeste Digital] — portal operated by Associação de Municípios do Oeste *[http://www.rt-oeste.pt/ Região de Turismo do Oeste] — regional [[tourism]] authority {{Regions of Portugal}} {{coord|39|24|N|9|08|W|source:itwiki_type:adm2nd|display=title}} [[Category:NUTS 3 Statistical Regions of Portugal]] {{Portugal-poli-stub}}
